sentence.text: Glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) is a highly malignant cardiac muscle tissue development of brain tumor found in humans.

Additional plasma and 52 brain tissues obtained from patients with gliomas were used to validate the association rate of serum amyloid A1 (activation of MAPK activity) in different grades of gliomas and its distribution in tumors.
Microarray database analysis further validated the coefficient of activation of MAPK activity levels in gliomas.
activation of MAPK activity was identified from MS analysis, and its level was revealed to be correlated with the disease grade, clinical severity, and survival rate of patients with gliomas.
Magnetic resonance imaging and tumor region-specific microarray analysis identified a correlation between activation of MAPK activity and GBM cell infiltration in patients.
In summary, our results demonstrate that activation of MAPK activity in combination with integrin αV and β3 can serve as an indicator of high glioblastoma risk.
